name: Beef Short Ribs
variables:
• 1 (750-ml) bottle dry red wine, such as Cabernet Sauvignon
  • 1 cup diced (1/2-inch) yellow onion
  • 1 cup 1/2-inch-thick slices peeled carrots
  • 1 cup 1/2-inch-thick slices leeks (white and light green parts only)
  • 1 cup thinly sliced shallots
  • 1 cup thinly sliced button mushrooms and/or mushrooms stems
  • 3 thyme sprigs
  • 6-flat-leaf parsley sprigs
  • 2 bay leaves
  • 1/2 teaspoon black peppercorns
  • 3 large garlic cloves, smashed, skin left on

    • Braising Variables:

    • 2-3 pounds boneless chuck short rib
    • Kosher salt and fresh ground black pepper
    • Canola oil
    • 1 cup diced (1/2 inch) yellow onion
    • 2/3 cup 1/2-inch thick slices peeled carrot
    • 1 1/2 cup 1/2 inch thick slices leeks (white and light green parts only)
    • 2 garlic cloves, smashed, skin left on
    • 3 thyme sprigs
    • 2 bay leaves
    • About 5 cups beef stock
    • 1-2 tablespoons corn starch
algorithm:
• Trim Short Ribs of silverskin and excess fat.
  • Braise Short Ribs in hot Canola Oil in Dutch Oven, set short ribs aside on dish as they finish.
  • In the braising pot combine all ingredients of the red wine reduction. Simmer till the wine is reduced to a glaze.
  • After the wine reduction has reduced, place the remaining ingredients into the pot and place the short ribs atop. Pouring the broth till it almost covers them all.
  • Place in oven at 350°F for 2-3hrs. Take a fork and press on it, not stab, it should start to smoosh apart.
  • Transfer the meat to a heat proof container.
  • Strain the braising liquid through a mesh strainer.
  • Skim remaining fat off top of liquid.
  • Reduce liquid down with corn startch. Begin with a slurry of 1 Tblspn, continue to desired viscosity.

name: Pork Carnitas
variables:
• 3-4 pounds of pork shoulder (butt)
  • 1 yellow onion diced (1/2 inch)
  • 2 peeled carrots
  • 4 large garlic cloves, pressed
  • 1 poblano pepper
  • 1 jalapeno pepper
  • 1 green/red pepper
  • 2 pieces bacon
  • 1 tomato
  • 1 orange
  • 4 sprigs of thyme
  • 1 tablespoons cumin
  • 2 tablespoons chili powder
  • 1 tablespoons oregano
  • 1/2 teaspoon paprika
algorithm:
• Rinse and dry Pork Shoulder.
  • Massage the seasonings into the meat.
  • Place in slow cooker fat side up, and top with the herbs, peppers, onions and garlic.
  • Cook on low for 10hrs. Finished when the meat shreds easily with a fork.
  • Remove and shred with a fork in caserole dish. Skim the fat from the juice, and set aside the remaining liquid.
  • Reduce liquid down to @2 cups. Pour half over shredded pork.
  • Place in oven (broil) @425°F for 15mins till crispy bits form.
  • Remove from oven and pour remaining juices over shredded pork.
  • Serve with whatever suits your fancy.

name: Ramen
variables:
• 1 pound filet mignon or teres major steaks
  • 1 pound beef soup bones
  • 1 medium onion
  • 1 medium ginger root
  • 2 stalks celery
  • 14oz mushrooms
  • 2 cloves garlic, smashed
  • 1 tablespoon soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon sesame oil
  • 1 teaspoon oriental 5 spice (optional)
  • 6 cups water with appropriate bouillon
  • Hard boiled eggs
  • Jalapeno peppers
  • Parsley
  • *extra vegetables in broth*
algorithm:
• Season steak with salt liberally, and let rest at room temperature for 20mins.
  • Heat canola oil in a pan till shimmering (realy hot) but not smoking.
  • Sear the meat to desired temperature, set aside.
  • Reduce to medium heat, and deglaze the pot with the onions and a little oil. Stir till all the burnt bits are loose from the bottom of the pot.
  • Add ginger, garlic, celery and mushrooms. Cook till celery is barely crunchy.
  • Add soup bones, and soy sauce. Simmmer for 1-2hrs till bone marrow is disolved.
  • Remove the bones and strain the broth.
  • Cook vegetables for broth to desired tenderness.
  • Cook noodles.
  • Slice steak to desired thickness.
  • Combine all prepared ingredients in a soup bowl.
  • Serve with hardboiled egg, fresh jalapenos and parsley.

name: Beef Pot Pie
variables:
• Beef Short Ribs Recipe
  • 1 cup green peas
  • 1 cup cubed carrots
  • 1 cup cubed celery
  • 1/2 cup diced onions
  • 1 cup cubed potatoes (roasted)
  • 1 package pastry dough
  • 1 egg (beaten to wash dough)
    • "
algorithm:
• Cube short ribs
  • Cook vegetables in a little chicken broth till al dente (reserve peas as they will cook enough in the pot pie).
  • Mix vegetables, meat and gravy together.
  • Grease large muffin tin.
  • Line each with pastry dough, and egg wash bottoms.
  • Fill with short rib gravy mixture.
  • Top with pastry dough, and egg wash.
  • Bake at 375°F for @45mins.

name: Barley Soup
variables:
• 1-2 pounds beef chuck roast
  • 4 carrots (2 for broth, 2 for soup)
  • 4 stalks celery (broth and soup)
  • 1 package mushrooms
  • 3 cloves garlic, smashed
  • 1 1/2 cups pearl barley
  • 10 cups water with appropriate beef bouillon
  • 2 bay leafs
  • @2 tablespoons corn startch
algorithm:
• Braise Beef in Dutch Oven. Set aside as it is finished.
  • Deglaze pan with onions and a little beef broth.
  • Add celery, carrots, garlic, beef broth and bay leafs.
  • Bring to boil and reduce to a simmer.
  • Add beef and beef bones (optional), simmer for 1 - 2 hrs.
  • Strain broth, remove beef and return broth back to pot.
  • Cook carrots, celery indepently to desired texture.
  • Cube beef and return back to broth. Add cooked vegetables and tomatoes.
  • Add barely and bring to boil, reduce to simmer for @45mins till barely is tender.
  • Make corn starch slurry 1 tblspn at a time and add till desired viscosity.

name: Lamb Shank a la Matignon
variables:
• 4 medium lamb shanks, each 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 lb.
  • Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
  • 1/2 cup water or low-salt chicken stock
  • 3 large onions, cut into 3/8-inch dice
  • 4 large carrots, cut into 3/8-inch dice
  • 2 large leeks, cut into 3/8-inch dice and rinsed well
  • 4 large garlic cloves, peeled and lightly crushed
  • 6 thyme sprigs
  • 6 parsley stems
  • 2 fresh bay leaves
  • 1 cup red wine
  • 1 Tbs. red wine vinegar
algorithm:
• Preheat an oven to 275°F
  • Rinse and dry Lamb Shanks.
  • Sprinkle liberally with salt all over.
  • Braise in hot canola oil and set aside.
  • Pour the water into the hot pan and use a wooden spatula to help scrape off any caramelized bits from the bottom of the pan.
  • When almost all of the liquid has evaporated, add the onions, carrots, leeks, garlic, herbs, 1 Tbs. canola oil and 1 tsp. kosher salt.
  • Stir the vegetables frequently until they just begin to become translucent.
  • Add the red wine and increase the heat to high. Boil the wine until you can no longer smell the alcohol, then reduce the heat to a simmer.
  • Cover the pan with the lid. Return the liquid to a simmer, then transfer the pan to the center of the oven.
  • Bake @3 hours, till they are almost falling from the bone.
  • Reduce the oven temperature to its lowest setting or about 150°F. Place the shanks back in the warm oven.
  • Strain the vegetables and liquid from the pan through a coarse-mesh strainer and collect them in a bowl or pot. Discard the vegetables.
  • Place the pan over medium heat, add the vinegar and bring the liquid to a boil. Continue to reduce the liquid to a slightly syrupy sauce consistency

name: Dumplings
variables:
• 1 egg
  • 1 package wonton wrappers
  • 1 pund ground pork
  • 3 shitake mushrooms
  • 1 cup scallions
  • 1 tablespoon soy sauce
  • 2 tablespoons ginger
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 2 tablesppons sesame oil
  • salt and pepper
algorithm:
• Salt Cabbage and drain excess water
  • Mix all ingredients
  • Place @1 teaspoon of mixture in wonton
  • Wrap wonton however your heart suits (practice will make it easier)
  • Cook: Pan fry, Steam, etc.

    • Pan Fry tips:

    1. Oil pan and heat over med-high heat, till oil shimmers.
    2. Place wontons in pan, just enough room that they wont stick to eachother.
    3. Sear for 5-6mins, adjusting heat to not burn, but still sizzling.
    4. Deglaze with @1/4 cup of water (pour it around the edges).
    5. Cover and steam for @2mins till no water remains.
    6. Remove from heat.
    7. The wontons should pop from the bottom of the pan with a nice golden-brown base.

name: Beef Mushroom
variables:
• Beef Short Ribs Recipe
  • 4 cups green vegetable
  • 6 medium potoates
  • 6 sprigs rosemary
  • 2 cups milk
  • Butter
  • Salt Pepper
    • "
algorithm:
• Peel and cut potoates. Let rest in cold water with 3 sprigs of rosemary for @2hrs.
  • Cube short ribs
  • Add gravy to sauce pan, bring to gentle simmer.
  • Add mushrooms to simmering gravy. Cook till tender.
  • Bring potatoes and salted water to boil. Put remaining rosemary sprigs in. Boil till potatoes are tender.
  • Remove rosemary sprigs. Add salt, milk and butter to potatoes. Mash to desired texture.
  • Combine and serve.

name: Chicken Dumplings Soup
variables:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 4 teaspoons baking powder
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1/4 teaspoon pepper
  • 1 large egg, beaten
  • 2 tablespoons butter, melted
  • 3/4 to 1 cup whole milk
  • 1/4 cup parsley, diced fine
algorithm:
• 3 large carrots, chopped 1/4"
  • 1 cup green peas
  • 3 stalks celery

name: Blueberry Pie
variables:
• 5 cups blueberries
  • 1/2 cup white sugar
  • 3/4 cup brown sugar
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1 pinch of salt
  • 1 splash of lemon juice
  • 1 tablespoon butter
  • 1 cup water (or champagne)
  • 2 sprigs fresh thyme (or rosemary)
  • 1 9" Pie Pastry
    • "
algorithm:
• Destem and wash blueberries.
  • Place 2 cups blueberries in pot with the water, and half of the sugar and cinnamon.
  • Bring to a boil, add thyme.
  • Reduce liquid down to a blueberry gravy, stirring frequently and breaking some in the process.
  • Add remaining fresh blueberries and a splash of lemon juice after you remove from the heat.
  • Grease pie tin, and line with pie pastry.
  • Egg wash bottom pie pastry.
  • Pour blueberry gravy into the pie tin.
  • Top with top pie pastry and egg wash, top with dots of butter.
  • Bake for @45mins at 375°F.

name: Bolognese
variables:
• 1 large yellow onion, finely chopped
  • 3 large carrots, finely chopped
  • 3 ribs celery, finely chopped
  • 1 tomato peeled, no seeds, diced
  • 5 garlic cloves, finely chopped
  • 6 sprigs fresh thyme
  • salt and pepper
  • 1 1/2 pound ground beef chuck
  • 1/2 pound ground veal
  • 1/2 pound ground pork
  • 6 ounces tomato paste (maybe more)
  • 1 cup Lambrusco (Fortissimo, Paisano, etc.)
  • 1 1/2 cups milk
  • 2 bay leaves
algorithm:
• In a medium, heavy-bottom pot, heat 2 tablespoons canola oil over medium-high heat.
  • Add the onion, carrots, celery, garlic and thyme and season with salt.
  • Cook, stirring regularly using a wooden spoon, until the vegetables are tender.
  • Add the beef, veal and pork, stirring and breaking up over high heat.
  • Season with salt and several grinds pepper, to taste.
  • Continue to cook over high heat until the meat is brown, stirring regularly, keep the meat and vegetables from scorching.
  • Once the meat is browned, stir in the tomato paste over medium heat. Cook for about 20 minutes, stirring regularly, to marry the flavors.
  • Add the wine, bring to a boil and cook until the wine is reduced by half.
  • Add the milk and bay leaves and bring to a boil.
  • Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for 2 hours, stirring occasionally.
  • You may need to add a bit of water (or chicken or veal stock, if you have it) to thin the sauce if it thickens too much.
  • Taste the sauce and season with salt and several grinds of pepper.
  • Remove from heat and stir to release the steam and allow it to cool slightly.

name: Pork Roast
variables:

  • 2 large leeks, chopped
  • 1 large onion, chopped
  • 6 large carrots, chopped

  • 2 tomatoes

  • Place wontons in pan, just enough room that they wont stick to eachother.
  • Sear for 5-6mins, adjusting heat to not burn, but still sizzling.
  • Deglaze with @1/4 cup of water (pour it around the edges).
  • Cover and steam for @2mins till no water remains.
  • Remove from heat.
  • The wontons should pop from the bottom of the pan with a nice golden-brown base.
algorithm:
• Cut the smoked salmon into a 1/4" dice. Let rest at room temperature.
  • Place the salmon fillet in a glass baking dish. Sprinkle each side with 1 tbs of Pernod

name: Italian Beef

  • 1 tablespoon dried rosemary
  • 1 tablespoon dried thyme

  • 5 cloves garlic
  • 1 medium onion
  • 2 bay leaf
  • 4 pound chuck roast
